Article.ArticleTitle: COVID-19 and Down syndrome: the spark in the fuel.

Abstract.AbstractText: In individuals with Down syndrome, immune dysregulation is partially caused by chromosome 21 trisomy. Here, we discuss how these immune differences may result in poorer COVID-19 outcomes, including diminished responses to vaccination and possibly elevated risk for long COVID.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: Pathology Advanced Translational Research Unit (PATRU), Department of Pathology & Laboratory Medicine, Emory University School of Medicine, Atlanta, GA, US.
Pathology Advanced Translational Research Unit (PATRU), Department of Pathology & Laboratory Medicine, Emory University School of Medicine, Atlanta, GA, US. susan.pereira.ribeiro@emory.edu.
